info.title: Brooklyn Client Ref
info.description: Client API endpoints for the Synamedia Brooklyn Video Platform

get.description: Retrieve the version of the API

This API is deprecated. The 3 new APIs resources/initial + shared/resources/uisettings and shared/resources/dictionary should be used instead.
Get a set of UI configurations to be applied in the app. These are app configs, hosted in the server.
Relevant only for Synamedia apps.
This shall be the first call that the application makes to the refAPI.
The response may contain httpCookies which should then be passed to every subsequent refAPI invocation.
Therefore all subsequent app-boot calls to ctap must be sent out only after the response to this call has been received.

parameters.name: Accept-Language
parameters.description:
Identifies the requested response language. This should be an ISO 639-1 two letter code. Subcodes (like en-GB) are aslo supported.
Give this header in GET methods where the response can be returned in different natural languages.
note: if the x-response-lang header is also given, its value will take precedence over the value of this header.

parameters.name: x-response-lang
parameters.description:
Identifies the requested response language. This should be an ISO 639-1 two letter code. Subcodes (like en-GB) are aslo supported.
Give this header in GET methods where the response can be returned in different natural languages.
This header is supported in addtion to the standard 'Accept-Language' header. If both are given, the value in this header will be used.

parameters.name: clientDictionaryDate
parameters.description: When given, and when the feature is enabled in server-side configuration, the set of dictionary keys + values to be used in the app will be included in the response (see the 'dictionary' field of the response schema). The language of the dictionary in the response is set according to the given language header. If there is no dictionary available for the requested language, no dictionary will be set in the response. This should be a ISO 8601 compliant UTC date time indicating the latest timestamp of the dictionary for this language currently stored in client persistent storage. It should be set according to the value of the dictionary->updateDate field from the previous resources/customization dictionary response for this language. Can be set to 0 in order to force dictionary retrieval, or when no dictionary has yet been stored for the current language.

get.description:
Get personal and general information that is needed by the client for its boot sequence.
Relevant only for Synamedia apps.
This shall be the first call that the application makes to the refAPI and it replaces the call to /resources/customization
The response may contain httpCookies which should then be passed to every subsequent refAPI invocation.
Therefore all subsequent app-boot calls to ctap must be sent out only after the response to this call has been received.

parameters.name: Accept-Language
parameters.description:
Identifies the requested response language. This should be an ISO 639-1 two letter code. Subcodes (like en-GB) are aslo supported.
Give this header in GET methods where the response can be returned in different natural languages.
note: if the x-response-lang header is also given, its value will take precedence over the value of this header.

parameters.name: x-response-lang
parameters.description:
Identifies the requested response language. This should be an ISO 639-1 two letter code. Subcodes (like en-GB) are aslo supported.
Give this header in GET methods where the response can be returned in different natural languages.
This header is supported in addtion to the standard 'Accept-Language' header. If both are given, the value in this header will be used.

parameters.name: isByoux
parameters.description: If BYOUX clients want to use the resources/initial API in order to fetch much of the data that is required during client boot in a single call they must supply this queryParam with the value true.

householdData.description: Data which can also be retrieved using /household/me API

deviceData.description: Data which can also be retrieved using the /devices/me or the /household/me/devices/me API

get.description:
Get a list of channels with their events.
This API can be used to get either current/future events or catchup events for the channels.
Current/future and catchup events cannot be retrieved in the same call.
In order to fetch catchup events either the pastEventsLimit param or the catchupFilter flag (with the value 'onlyCatchup') should be used.
In order to fetch current/future events the eventsLimit param or the duration params should be used.
In order to fetch only channels without events, the GET /channels API should be used.

parameters.name: Accept-Language
parameters.description:
Identifies the requested response language. This should be an ISO 639-1 two letter code. Subcodes (like en-GB) are aslo supported.
Give this header in GET methods where the response can be returned in different natural languages.
note: if the x-response-lang header is also given, its value will take precedence over the value of this header.

parameters.name: x-response-lang
parameters.description:
Identifies the requested response language. This should be an ISO 639-1 two letter code. Subcodes (like en-GB) are aslo supported.
Give this header in GET methods where the response can be returned in different natural languages.
This header is supported in addtion to the standard 'Accept-Language' header. If both are given, the value in this header will be used.

parameters.name: scheduleOnly
parameters.description: When set to true the response doesn't include any channel properties except of channel id. The parameter is handled starting from API version 1.6.0

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of entries to return in the response list.

parameters.name: isPlayable
parameters.description: Filter for channels which are consumable in the current device (i.e. the channel's format is playable on the device). If this filter false or not given, both playable and non playable channels are returned. If true, return only playable channels.

parameters.name: isEntitled
parameters.description: Filter for channels which the household associated to this device is entitled to. If this filter is false or not given, return entitled and not entitled channels. If true, return only entitled channels.

parameters.name: startDateTime
parameters.description:
ISO 8601 compliant UTC date time, defining the start of a time windowed reponse list.
This value is inclusive; entities starting earlier and ongoing at this time will be included in the response.
Shall be accompanied by one of `duration` XOR `eventsLimit` XOR `pastEventsLimit`.
If not provided, the system will use the current time.
Example: "2015-10-05T14:30Z" is UTC 5th October 2105 2:30pm.

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description:
Duration in seconds, defining the end of a time windowed response list relative to `startTime`.
Shall not be supplied together with `eventsLimit`. If neither startDateTime nor duration are supplied, the default duration is 12 hours.
Example: 9000 - 2hrs 30min duration.

parameters.name: eventsLimit
parameters.description:
Number of events returned per channel relative to the specified startTime.
This parameter shall not be supplied together with `duration`.

parameters.name: pastEventsLimit
parameters.description:
Number of past events returned per channel relative to the specified startTime.
This parameter will be used to fetch catchup events.
Shall not be supplied together with `duration`.

parameters.name: filterCurrentEvent
parameters.description: Filter out the currently playing live event.

parameters.name: carousel
parameters.description: Flag indicating whether to loop back to the beginning of the response list upon reaching the end.

parameters.name: channelId
parameters.description:
__locator__; GUID of the channel that is used as the base location point of the offset in the response list.
This channel will be the first in the returned list.
Shall not be supplied together with any other locator, otherwise a 400 response will be returned.
If not provided, the system uses the first channel in the channel list for the client

parameters.name: logicalChannelNumber
parameters.description:
__locator__; Logical channel number of the channel (relevant for the calling device) that is used as the base location point of the offset in the response list.
This channel will be the first in the returned list.
This parameter should be used for direct channel access. Shall not be supplied together with any other locator, otherwise a 400 response will be returned.
default is the first channel in the channel list for the client.

parameters.name: genreId
parameters.description: Filter resources to those associated with the supplied genreId

parameters.name: catchupFilter
parameters.description: Filter catchup events.

parameters.name: isFavourite
parameters.description: Filter the channels based on them being in the favorite list. If this filter is false or not given, return favourite and non-favourite channels.

parameters.name: radioFilter
parameters.description:
Filter Radio channels. If not provided, radio channels are NOT included in the response.
withRadio -> Radio channels AND other channels (video) are provided in the response.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description:
Starting point relative to a location (specified by the locator, channelId or logicalChannelNumber parameter) where entries in the response list should be selected from.
Limited to 255 to prevent long running queries on the implementation.
Clients should get results to obtain a new locator, channelId or logicalChannelNumber (depending on API) to page further through the list.

schema.description: Schema for list of channels with events

get.description:
Get a list of Content and ContentInstances matching the supplied criteria.  Used for Searching and Store browsing use cases.
Note: the seriesFilter param is currently supported only together with the offerKeys param, and the 'All' value is not currently supported. The default value is 'noSeries'.

parameters.name: Accept-Language
parameters.description:
Identifies the requested response language. This should be an ISO 639-1 two letter code. Subcodes (like en-GB) are aslo supported.
Give this header in GET methods where the response can be returned in different natural languages.
note: if the x-response-lang header is also given, its value will take precedence over the value of this header.

parameters.name: x-response-lang
parameters.description:
Identifies the requested response language. This should be an ISO 639-1 two letter code. Subcodes (like en-GB) are aslo supported.
Give this header in GET methods where the response can be returned in different natural languages.
This header is supported in addtion to the standard 'Accept-Language' header. If both are given, the value in this header will be used.

parameters.name: categoryId
parameters.description: Id of the category to display content for

parameters.name: source
parameters.description:
Comma separated list to filter content instance source. Valid values:
* ltv - broadcast TV content
* vod - video on demand content
* pvr - pvr recorded content
* catchup - online catchup content
* editorial - editorially curated content, can be a mix of different sources
* youtube - federated youtube content (supported only for search flows and can't be use together with other sources)

parameters.name: groupId
parameters.description: Return content that belongs to a specific group

parameters.name: showId
parameters.description:
Return content that belongs to a specific vod/catchup showId. For pvr shows, call agg/library?showId.
For linear shows, only uncollapse through search is supported. Therefore the 'q' query phrase must also be supplied together with the showId.
In order to fetch the episodes of an open series (that has no seasons) the parameter isCollapsed=false should be given explicitly.

parameters.name: seasonId
parameters.description:
Return content that belongs to a specific vod/catchup seasonId. For pvr shows, call agg/library?seasonId.
For linear shows, only uncollapse through search is supported. Therefore the 'q' query phrase must also be supplied together with the seasonId. In addition to the search phrase, the showId should also be given, and the isCollapsed=false param must be specified.

parameters.name: ignoreExpiry
parameters.description:
Specifies if when uncollapsing a given vod show/season/group assets that are already expired should be returned.
This parameter is accepted only when groupId/showId/seasonId is given and only for source=vod

parameters.name: isCollapsed
parameters.description:
Specifies if to return collapsed content or not. By default it is defined by autoCollapse classification
specification definition.

parameters.name: storePhrase
parameters.description:
Specifies if to save the given phrase prefix in search history
NOTE: storePhrase is currently supported only when the searchOptions param is given with the value matchPhrasePrefix (storage of full phrases is handled by the system in a way that is transparent to the client).

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description:
Starting point relative to a location (specified by the locator, channelId or logicalChannelNumber parameter) where entries in the response list should be selected from.
Clients should get results to obtain a new locator, channelId or logicalChannelNumber (depending on API) to page further through the list.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of entries to return in the response list.

parameters.name: topLevelFilterTag
parameters.description:
When this query parameter is given, the returned items will be filtered by this value which can either be:
    1. top level genre.
    2. filteringTag field returned by vodContent for the given asset.
(The operator will attach filteringTags to given classifications in VMS. This serves as a kind of alias for the classification.)

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: phrase to search for (exact match in case searchOptions is not specified) within title, cast and keywords.  The value must be URL encoded to support special characters (+, &, ? etc)

parameters.name: searchOptions
parameters.description:
Control search criteria options. Valid values:
* matchPhrase - exact match. (default in case no parameter is defined)
* matchPhrasePrefix - enable prefix match.

parameters.name: isAdult
parameters.description: Setting the parameter to true will include content marked as Adult in the resulting list. If this parameter is not defined the adult content will be filtered out.

parameters.name: isErotic
parameters.description: Setting the parameter to true will include content marked as Erotic in the resulting list. If this parameter is not defined the erotic content will be filtered out.

parameters.name: genreId
parameters.description: Filter resources to those associated with the supplied genreId

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
Define sorting for the result. The optional values are:
* title - AZ sort by title feild. Used -title to sort in decending order.
* date - sort by date. Broadcast data for live TV, recording date for PVR, purchase data for phurchased vod and release date for vod
  use -date to sort by date in decending order.
* type - sort by content type. The sort is ordered by the order of the types in the type feild.
* productionYear - sort by producetion year
* expirationDateTime - sort by content expiry date
* episodeNumber - for calls to get episodes of a season/open show - sort by episode number.
  Use -episodeNumber for decending order sort.
* seasonNumber - for calls to get seasons of a show - sort by seasonNumber.
  Use -seasonNumber for decending order sort.

parameters.name: offerKeys
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of offerKeys.

parameters.name: seriesFilter
parameters.description: Filter resources which are part of series or a show.

parameters.name: locator
parameters.description:
Identifies a logical location in the list to locate the pagination at.
This parameter is used as the location point as a base for the offset parameter.
Values are opaque to the client and retrieved from previous calls to a list API.
If no `locator` or other locating parameter supplied the response will be at the start of the list.

200.description: The list of content matching the request query

schema.description: Schema for a list of Content

content.synopsis: Peter Parker is beset with troubles in his failing personal life as he battles a brilliant scientist named Doctor Otto Octavius.

content.title: Pilot
content.synopsis: FBI Agent Booth needs forensic anthropologist Dr. Brennan's help to solve the case of a decomposed body found in a pond in Arlington National Cemetery. She agrees to help if she is a full partner in the case.

get.description:
Get recommended assets related to the given content.
In case of linear recommendation, startTime + duration will define the
time window for the recommended assets. If not given, the default values will be startDateTime=now, and duration=24hours.
In case of vod recommendation these params will be ignored.
For vod source, any episodes or group content in the result will be collapsed.

parameters.name: Accept-Language
parameters.description:
Identifies the requested response language. This should be an ISO 639-1 two letter code. Subcodes (like en-GB) are aslo supported.
Give this header in GET methods where the response can be returned in different natural languages.
note: if the x-response-lang header is also given, its value will take precedence over the value of this header.

parameters.name: x-response-lang
parameters.description:
Identifies the requested response language. This should be an ISO 639-1 two letter code. Subcodes (like en-GB) are aslo supported.
Give this header in GET methods where the response can be returned in different natural languages.
This header is supported in addtion to the standard 'Accept-Language' header. If both are given, the value in this header will be used.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description:
Number of assets to return.
NOTE the default limit is defined as 255, but this should not be used.
Instead the client should limit every invocation to the number of assets it actually needs for the display

parameters.name: contentId
parameters.description: The recommended assets returned will be related to the given content.

parameters.name: source
parameters.description:
Comma separated list to filter recommended content instance source. Valid values:
  * vod - video on demand content
  * ltv - broadcast TV content (linear)

parameters.name: topLevelFilterTag
parameters.description:
When this query parameter is defined, only content items that are associated with at least one of the given filteringTags will be returned.
The topLevelFilterTag values are defined by the provider in the vod content ingest.
Note: the filtering tags to be used for related content is not the same set as are used for non-related content.
This is a different set of tags, per top level screen.
[In IA2.0 the value to be used should be read from the metadata of the classification of the hubScreen, in the actionMenu->relatedTopLevelFilterTags field.]
[In IA1.0 the value to use should be read from the uisettings file]

parameters.name: isAdult
parameters.description: Setting the parameter to true will include content marked as Adult in the resulting list. If this parameter is not defined the adult content will be filtered out.

parameters.name: isErotic
parameters.description: Setting the parameter to true will include content marked as Erotic in the resulting list. If this parameter is not defined the erotic content will be filtered out.

parameters.name: startDateTime
parameters.description:
ISO 8601 compliant UTC date time, defining the start of a time windowed reponse list.
This value is inclusive; entities starting earlier and ongoing at this time will be included in the response.
Shall be accompanied by one of `duration` XOR `eventsLimit`.
If not provided, the system will use the current time.

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description:
Duration in seconds, defining the end of a time windowed response list relative to `startTime`.
Example: 9000 - 2hrs 30min duration.
Shall not be supplied together with `eventsLimit`.

200.description: The list of recommendations matching the request query

get.description:
Get general recommendations for live or vod assets. The recommendations
can be based on personal viewing information or be general recommendations.
In case of linear recommendation, startTime + duration will define the
time window for the recommended assets. If not given, the default values will be startDateTime=now, and duration=24hours.
In case of vod recommendation these params will be ignored.
Note: the topLevelFilterTag parameter and the recommendationGenre/recommendationSubGenre parameters are mutually exclusive.
For vod source, any episodes or group content in the result will be collapsed.

parameters.name: Accept-Language
parameters.description:
Identifies the requested response language. This should be an ISO 639-1 two letter code. Subcodes (like en-GB) are aslo supported.
Give this header in GET methods where the response can be returned in different natural languages.
note: if the x-response-lang header is also given, its value will take precedence over the value of this header.

parameters.name: x-response-lang
parameters.description:
Identifies the requested response language. This should be an ISO 639-1 two letter code. Subcodes (like en-GB) are aslo supported.
Give this header in GET methods where the response can be returned in different natural languages.
This header is supported in addtion to the standard 'Accept-Language' header. If both are given, the value in this header will be used.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description:
Number of assets to return.
NOTE the default limit is defined as 64, but this should not be used.
Instead the client should limit every invocation to the number of assets it actually needs for the display

parameters.name: source
parameters.description:
Comma separated list to filter recommended content instance source. Valid values:
* vod - video on demand content
* ltv - broadcast TV content (linear)

parameters.name: isPersonal
parameters.description:
Use personal viewing preferences as an input to recommendation engine. When false the result will be general recommendations.
When true the result will be based on personal viewing information.

parameters.name: recommendationGenre
parameters.description:
When this query parameter is defined, the preference items will be filtered
by their genre as ingested to recommendation engine. Only items that are part of the given genre will be returned.
The values for recommendationsGenre are different per service provider and may be a subset
or disjoint set of genres than what is returned by the /categories API

parameters.name: recommendationSubGenre
parameters.description:
Comma separated list to filter content by.
This query parameter can be defined only if recommendationGenre is defined.
When this query parameter is defined, the preference items will be filtered
by their recommendationGenre **and** recommendationSubGenre as ingested to recommendation engine.
Only items that are part of the given recommendationGenre and recommendationSubGenre will be returned.

parameters.name: topLevelFilterTag
parameters.description:
When this query parameter is given, the returned items will be filtered by this value which can either be:
    1. top level genre.
    2. filteringTag field returned by vodContent for the given asset.
(The operator will attach filteringTags to given classifications in VMS. This serves as a kind of alias for the classification.)

parameters.name: isAdult
parameters.description: Setting the parameter to true will include content marked as Adult in the resulting list. If this parameter is not defined the adult content will be filtered out.

parameters.name: isErotic
parameters.description: Setting the parameter to true will include content marked as Erotic in the resulting list. If this parameter is not defined the erotic content will be filtered out.

parameters.name: startDateTime
parameters.description:
ISO 8601 compliant UTC date time, defining the start of a time windowed reponse list.
This value is inclusive; entities starting earlier and ongoing at this time will be included in the response.
Shall be accompanied by one of `duration` XOR `eventsLimit`.
If not provided, the system will use the current time.

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description:
Duration in seconds, defining the end of a time windowed response list relative to `startTime`.
Example: 9000 - 2hrs 30min duration.
Shall not be supplied together with `eventsLimit`.

200.description: The list of recommendations matching the request query

get.description:
Get most popular content. (The time period over which to calculate the most popular content is set by the headend)
Note: series/group vod content will return collapsed. catchup and ltv series/group content will not return collapsed.
The vodFiltered and topLevelFilterTag parameters are supported only for vod source.
The excludeGenres parameter is supported only for catchup source.

parameters.name: Accept-Language
parameters.description:
Identifies the requested response language. This should be an ISO 639-1 two letter code. Subcodes (like en-GB) are aslo supported.
Give this header in GET methods where the response can be returned in different natural languages.
note: if the x-response-lang header is also given, its value will take precedence over the value of this header.

parameters.name: x-response-lang
parameters.description:
Identifies the requested response language. This should be an ISO 639-1 two letter code. Subcodes (like en-GB) are aslo supported.
Give this header in GET methods where the response can be returned in different natural languages.
This header is supported in addtion to the standard 'Accept-Language' header. If both are given, the value in this header will be used.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of assets to return

parameters.name: source
parameters.description:
The source from which to return the topList recommendations. **currently only single sources are supported**
* vod - video on demand content
* ltv - broadcast TV content (linear)
* catchup - recorded catchup content

parameters.name: excludeGenres
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of genres to exclude from the response. Supported only for the catchup source.

parameters.name: topLevelFilterTag
parameters.description:
When this query parameter is given, the returned items will be filtered by this value which can either be:
    1. top level genre.
    2. filteringTag field returned by vodContent for the given asset.
(The operator will attach filteringTags to given classifications in VMS. This serves as a kind of alias for the classification.)

parameters.name: isAdult
parameters.description: Setting the parameter to true will include content marked as Adult in the resulting list. If this parameter is not defined the adult content will be filtered out.

parameters.name: isErotic
parameters.description: Setting the parameter to true will include content marked as Erotic in the resulting list. If this parameter is not defined the erotic content will be filtered out.

parameters.name: vodFilter
parameters.description: Filter vod assets by their type

get.description:
Get latest viewed content and associated recommendations for live or vod assets.
The recommendations are based on recently viewed content.
UI comment: when this API is used for fetching and displaying swimlanes the result will be a set of <limit> swimlanes,
where each swimlane has <recommendationLimit> assets.
startTime + duration will define the time window in the past for computing recently viewed content.
If duration is not given, the default used is 86400 seconds (24 hours). If startDateTime is not given, the default used is (NOW-duration).
Vod assets will be collapsed in the response

parameters.name: Accept-Language
parameters.description:
Identifies the requested response language. This should be an ISO 639-1 two letter code. Subcodes (like en-GB) are aslo supported.
Give this header in GET methods where the response can be returned in different natural languages.
note: if the x-response-lang header is also given, its value will take precedence over the value of this header.

parameters.name: x-response-lang
parameters.description:
Identifies the requested response language. This should be an ISO 639-1 two letter code. Subcodes (like en-GB) are aslo supported.
Give this header in GET methods where the response can be returned in different natural languages.
This header is supported in addtion to the standard 'Accept-Language' header. If both are given, the value in this header will be used.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of recently viewed assets to return (seed assets)

parameters.name: recommendationLimit
parameters.description: Number of related assets to fetch for each seed asset

parameters.name: recommendationSource
parameters.description:
Comma seperated list to filter recommended content instance source. Valid values:
* vod - video on demand content
* ltv - broadcast TV content (linear)

parameters.name: topLevelFilterTag
parameters.description:
When this query parameter is given, the returned items will be filtered by this value which can either be:
    1. top level genre.
    2. filteringTag field returned by vodContent for the given asset.
(The operator will attach filteringTags to given classifications in VMS. This serves as a kind of alias for the classification.)

parameters.name: isAdult
parameters.description: Setting the parameter to true will include content marked as Adult in the resulting list. If this parameter is not defined the adult content will be filtered out.

parameters.name: isErotic
parameters.description: Setting the parameter to true will include content marked as Erotic in the resulting list. If this parameter is not defined the erotic content will be filtered out.

parameters.name: vodFilter
parameters.description: Filter vod assets by their type

parameters.name: startDateTime
parameters.description:
ISO 8601 compliant UTC date time, defining the start of a time windowed reponse list.
This value is inclusive; entities starting earlier and ongoing at this time will be included in the response.
Shall be accompanied by one of `duration` XOR `eventsLimit`.
If not provided, the system will use the current time.

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description:
Duration in seconds, defining the end of a time windowed response list relative to `startTime`.
Example: 9000 - 2hrs 30min duration.
Shall not be supplied together with `eventsLimit`.

get.description: Retrieve a list of bookings, possibly filtered by the given query parameters

parameters.name: Accept-Language
parameters.description:
Identifies the requested response language. This should be an ISO 639-1 two letter code. Subcodes (like en-GB) are aslo supported.
Give this header in GET methods where the response can be returned in different natural languages.
note: if the x-response-lang header is also given, its value will take precedence over the value of this header.

parameters.name: x-response-lang
parameters.description:
Identifies the requested response language. This should be an ISO 639-1 two letter code. Subcodes (like en-GB) are aslo supported.
Give this header in GET methods where the response can be returned in different natural languages.
This header is supported in addtion to the standard 'Accept-Language' header. If both are given, the value in this header will be used.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
Define sorting for the result. The optional values are:
* title - A to Z sort by title field.
* -title - Z to A sort by title field.
* date - sort by date, ascending.
* -date - sort by date, descending. This is the default behavior.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of entries to return in the response list.

parameters.name: topLevelFilterTag
parameters.description:
When this query parameter is given, the returned items will be filtered by this value which can either be:
    1. top level genre.
    2. filteringTag field returned by vodContent for the given asset.
(The operator will attach filteringTags to given classifications in VMS. This serves as a kind of alias for the classification.)

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description:
Starting point relative to a location (specified by the locator, channelId or logicalChannelNumber parameter) where entries in the response list should be selected from.
Limited to 255 to prevent long running queries on the implementation.
Clients should get results to obtain a new locator, channelId or logicalChannelNumber (depending on API) to page further through the list.

parameters.name: locator
parameters.description:
Identifies a logical location in the list to locate the pagination at.
This parameter is used as the location point as a base for the offset parameter.
Values are opaque to the client and retrieved from previous calls to a list API.
If no `locator` or other locating parameter supplied the response will be at the start of the list.

parameters.name: recordingState
parameters.description:
Filter on recordingState.
CSV of enumerated values of recordingState in recordingstate.schema.

parameters.name: seasonId
parameters.description:
Filter on the given seasonId.

parameters.name: deleteSeasonOption
parameters.description:
If the bookingId is part of a season booking, then this option can be used to delete bookings of the season.
If called without any parameters - all of the seasons bookings and recordings will be deleted.
The only supported value is:
  * seasonBookings:
    If called with the "deleteSeasonOption=seasonBookings" parameter, only the seasons bookings will be deleted, and the recorded episodes will be retained.
    Note: An on-going recording is still considered as a booking, so for the purpose of this API it will also be deleted.
    (If a playback is still ongoing, the playback should continue normally but discovery and new playback will not be possible and the backend will delete the recording after the playback is completed.)

post.description:
This API supports bulk deleting of recordings and notification of a local disk format.

Bulk Deleting
This API supports only shows and events (not seasons).
Warning: this API considers an ongoing recording as a recording and not as a booking, and therefore it will be deleted.
Performs an operation on a list of assets/shows according to the operation parameter given in the body.
Currently "delete" operation is supported which permanently deletes all assets and collaped shows in "recorded" or/and "recording" state - in the bookings list sent in body.
Parameters to be passed to the /agg/library/manageBookings resource with the HTTP method POST:
* operation: "delete"
* bookings: array of assets and shows according to bookingType: "event" or "show".
  - The id to give for bookingType 'event' is the `bookingId` of the standalone/episode booking.
  - The id to give for the bookingTye 'show' is the `showId` field. The `showId` is only available on the asset level (in the agg/library/planner response) - it is not returned as part of the booking (in the agg/library/bookings response)

Disk Formatted
This will delete all recordings for the device that called the API. It is expected to only be called by devices that support local DVR, after a local disk format has been performed. The call of this API by the device is to let Planner know that all references to local recordings for this device should be deleted, reflecting the local deletion of all recordings.
Calls to this API from non-local DVR devices will result in a Bad Request response explaining that the disk format API is not supported.

requestBody.description:
body contains 2 parameters: operation and bookings list.
"operation" for disk formatted is "diskFormatted" with no other properties in body
"operation" for bulk delete is "delete"
"bookings" is a list of the couple of id and type.
"bookingType" is "show"/"event", and "id" is showId/assetId respectively.

schema.description: delete all recordings or specific recorded and recording assetList or groups

parameters.name: Accept-Language
parameters.description:
Identifies the requested response language. This should be an ISO 639-1 two letter code. Subcodes (like en-GB) are aslo supported.
Give this header in GET methods where the response can be returned in different natural languages.
note: if the x-response-lang header is also given, its value will take precedence over the value of this header.

parameters.name: x-response-lang
parameters.description:
Identifies the requested response language. This should be an ISO 639-1 two letter code. Subcodes (like en-GB) are aslo supported.
Give this header in GET methods where the response can be returned in different natural languages.
This header is supported in addtion to the standard 'Accept-Language' header. If both are given, the value in this header will be used.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
Define sorting for the result. The optional values are:
* title - A to Z sort by title field.
* -title - Z to A sort by title field.
* date - sort by date, ascending.
* -date - sort by date, descending. This is the default behavior.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of entries to return in the response list.

parameters.name: topLevelFilterTag
parameters.description:
When this query parameter is given, the returned items will be filtered by this value which can either be:
    1. top level genre.
    2. filteringTag field returned by vodContent for the given asset.
(The operator will attach filteringTags to given classifications in VMS. This serves as a kind of alias for the classification.)

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description:
Starting point relative to a location (specified by the locator, channelId or logicalChannelNumber parameter) where entries in the response list should be selected from.
Limited to 255 to prevent long running queries on the implementation.
Clients should get results to obtain a new locator, channelId or logicalChannelNumber (depending on API) to page further through the list.

parameters.name: locator
parameters.description:
Identifies a logical location in the list to locate the pagination at.
This parameter is used as the location point as a base for the offset parameter.
Values are opaque to the client and retrieved from previous calls to a list API.
If no `locator` or other locating parameter supplied the response will be at the start of the list.

parameters.name: recordingState
parameters.description:
Filter on recordingState.
CSV of enumerated values of recordingState in recordingstate.schema.

parameters.name: seasonId
parameters.description:
Filter on the given seasonId.
The response will contain a list of booked/recorded episodes for the given seasonId

parameters.name: showId
parameters.description:
Filter on showId.
The response will contain a list of booked/recorded seasons (for a closed series) or episodes (for an open series) for the given showId

parameters.name: isAdult
parameters.description: Setting the parameter to true will include content marked as Adult in the resulting list. If this parameter is not defined the adult content will be filtered out.

parameters.name: isErotic
parameters.description: Setting the parameter to true will include content marked as Erotic in the resulting list. If this parameter is not defined the erotic content will be filtered out.

parameters.name: seriesFilter
parameters.description: Filter resources which are part of series or a show.

parameters.name: collapse
parameters.description:
Indicates if the response should be collapsed or not.
By default the behaviour of the API is to NOT collapse the items (ex: recorded episodes of a season)
Client can provide this queryparameter in case the response should be collapsed.
usage: "collapse=false"

* pvr - pvr recorded content
* vod - video on demand content
* catchup - catchup event (from TSTV)
* vodCatchup - catchup assets ingested into VOD catalog

parameters.name: showId
parameters.description:
Return next episode to watch for the given showId. Return asset can be the last episode that is
partially watched or the episode following the last episode that was fully watched.
In case the user watched the last episode or did not watch any episode, the return
value is set by the showFilterDefault parameter or by system default behaviour.
This param is only supported when the value of the 'recentSource' param is 'nextEpisodes'.

parameters.name: showFilterDefault
parameters.description:
enum: [firstEpisode,lastEpisode]
This flag defines the behaviour in case the nextEpisode is not found for a given show.
This can happen when no episode was watched by the users or when the last episode is fully watched by the user.
This param is only supported when showId param is used and the value of the 'recentSource' param is 'nextEpisodes'.
If the flag is not sent the behaviour will be defined by the HE. The flag is used when the
default HE behaviour should be override, for example when the default is changed per classification.
Supported Value:
  * firstEpisode - always return the first episode available for this series
  * lastEpisode - always return the last episode available for this series.

parameters.name: recentSource
parameters.description:
Comma separated list to retrieve recent assets. Valid values:
* partiallyViewed - Retrieve only assets that were recently partially viewed.
* nextEpisodes - Retrieve only personal VOD next episodes.
* partiallyViewed,nextEpisodes - Retrieve assets that were recently partially viewed and personal VOD next episodes.
* viewed - Retrieve assets that were recently fully viewed at least one time.
NOTE: next episodes - By default, if the last episode of a season has been watched fully, the first episode of
the next season will be returned. Unless showFilterDefault flag is set and equal to lastEpisode.
NOTE: next episodes is supported only for the vod source.

parameters.name: topLevelFilterTag
parameters.description:
When this query parameter is given, the returned items will be filtered by this value which can either be:
    1. top level genre.
    2. filteringTag field returned by vodContent for the given asset.
(The operator will attach filteringTags to given classifications in VMS. This serves as a kind of alias for the classification.)

parameters.name: isAdult
parameters.description: Setting the parameter to true will include content marked as Adult in the resulting list. If this parameter is not defined the adult content will be filtered out.

parameters.name: isErotic
parameters.description: Setting the parameter to true will include content marked as Erotic in the resulting list. If this parameter is not defined the erotic content will be filtered out.

parameters.name: collapse
parameters.description:
Indicates if the response should be collapsed or not.
By default the behaviour of the API is to NOT collapse the items (ex: recorded episodes of a season)
Client can provide this queryparameter in case the response should be collapsed.
usage: "collapse=false"

get.description:
NOTE: API is being deprecated and replaced with agg/library/recent using the recentSource parameter.
Retrieve all personal VOD next episodes. Single episode for each show.
If the last episode of a season has been watched fully, the first episode of the next season will be returned.
-- Usage with showID --
In case showId query parameter is used, the API will returns the next episode of the specific show, based on the viewing status.
In this case if the last episode the user watched is partially watched, it will be returned. Otherwise the next unwatched episode will be returned.
If none of the episodes was watched or if the series was fully watched - the behaviour will be determind by the showFilterDefault query parameter
(The default is to return the first episode available).

get.description: Retrieve a list of channels and their metadata, but without events.

parameters.name: Accept-Language
parameters.description:
Identifies the requested response language. This should be an ISO 639-1 two letter code. Subcodes (like en-GB) are aslo supported.
Give this header in GET methods where the response can be returned in different natural languages.
note: if the x-response-lang header is also given, its value will take precedence over the value of this header.

parameters.name: x-response-lang
parameters.description:
Identifies the requested response language. This should be an ISO 639-1 two letter code. Subcodes (like en-GB) are aslo supported.
Give this header in GET methods where the response can be returned in different natural languages.
This header is supported in addtion to the standard 'Accept-Language' header. If both are given, the value in this header will be used.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of entries to return in the response list.

parameters.name: isPlayable
parameters.description: Filter for channels which are consumable in the current device (i.e. the channel's format is playable on the device). If this filter false or not given, both playable and non playable channels are returned. If true, return only playable channels.

parameters.name: isEntitled
parameters.description: Filter for channels which the household associated to this device is entitled to. If this filter is false or not given, return entitled and not entitled channels. If true, return only entitled channels.

parameters.name: channelId
parameters.description:
__locator__; GUID of the channel that is used as the base location point of the offset in the response list.
This channel will be the first in the returned list.
Shall not be supplied together with any other locator, otherwise a 400 response will be returned.
If not provided, the system uses the first channel in the channel list for the client

parameters.name: logicalChannelNumber
parameters.description:
__locator__; Logical channel number of the channel (relevant for the calling device) that is used as the base location point of the offset in the response list.
This channel will be the first in the returned list.
This parameter should be used for direct channel access. Shall not be supplied together with any other locator, otherwise a 400 response will be returned.
default is the first channel in the channel list for the client.

parameters.name: genreId
parameters.description: Filter resources to those associated with the supplied genreId

parameters.name: radioFilter
parameters.description:
Filter Radio channels. If not provided, radio channels are NOT included in the response.
withRadio -> Radio channels AND other channels (video) are provided in the response.

parameters.name: offerKeys
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of offerKeys.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description:
Starting point relative to a location (specified by the locator, channelId or logicalChannelNumber parameter) where entries in the response list should be selected from.
Limited to 255 to prevent long running queries on the implementation.
Clients should get results to obtain a new locator, channelId or logicalChannelNumber (depending on API) to page further through the list.

Pagination is currently not supported.

parameters.description:
When set to true, the API will return all the relevant deliveries, including video format, for each channel, when set to false
Only the most fitting delivery according to the device features will be returned.

get.description:
Retrieve a list of the recently viewed channels of a user profile.
The currently playing channel (devices/me/settings/lastChannel) is filtered out of the response.
Channels are added to the list when they are viewed for more then a configurable viewing threshold,
and are ordered in reverse chronological sequence of most recently visited to least recently visited.
Note: In case it is not full, the list is filled from the channel lineup (the size of the list is configurable at the microservice holding the data)

parameters.name: Accept-Language
parameters.description:
Identifies the requested response language. This should be an ISO 639-1 two letter code. Subcodes (like en-GB) are aslo supported.
Give this header in GET methods where the response can be returned in different natural languages.
note: if the x-response-lang header is also given, its value will take precedence over the value of this header.

parameters.name: x-response-lang
parameters.description:
Identifies the requested response language. This should be an ISO 639-1 two letter code. Subcodes (like en-GB) are aslo supported.
Give this header in GET methods where the response can be returned in different natural languages.
This header is supported in addtion to the standard 'Accept-Language' header. If both are given, the value in this header will be used.

parameters.name: startDateTime
parameters.description:
ISO 8601 compliant UTC date time, defining the startTime for the events to return for each channel.
This value is inclusive - events starting earlier and ongoing at this time will be included in the response.
If not provided, the system will use the current time.

parameters.name: eventsLimit
parameters.description: Number of events returned per channel relative to the specified startDateTime.

parameters.name: currentChannelFirst
parameters.description:
When true the currently playing channel is returned as the first item in the response. When false or not given, the currently playing
channel will be filtered out of the response.

parameters.name: isPadded
parameters.description:
When true (or not given) if there are not <limit> recent channels available, the returned channel list is
padded with linear channels (starting with channel 1) from the channel lineup

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of channels to fetch.

post.description: Creates a download resource that will be used for downloading the content into the device and for following its status.

parameters.name: instanceId
parameters.description: The contentInstance Id of the content to download.

id.description: Download identifier, globally unique

drmType.description: The DRM type used by this client

blob.description: An opaque blob to be passed by the application to the download component.  The download component will know how to unpack this blob into the required data.

drmProperties.description: An object supplying the DRM properties to use for download this content

expirationDate.description: The license expiration date of this download item irrespective of playback being initiated

retentionAfterPlayback.description: The expiration time in minutes after first playback of a successfully downloaded asset

downloadUrl.description: The URL the client should use to download the content.  The URL will be in a format appropriate for the device.

contentInstance.description: Link allowing the client to retrieve more information about the contentInstance associated with this session.  Only present if the session is an on demand (VOD, Planner, Catchup) session and not a linear channel session.

_links.description: A set of links to allow the client to retrieve related information and manipulate the session.

post.description:
Creates a play session that will be used for streaming content.
Content can be linear, VOD or DVR.
The deviceId must be set to the special value 'me'

parameters.name: channelId
parameters.description: ChannelId of the channel to tune to.

parameters.name: instanceId
parameters.description: The contentInstance Id of the content to watch.

parameters.name: startingPosition
parameters.description: Starting position for the play back of the content. It is passed through directly in the response. specified in seconds from the start of the content.

parameters.name: sessionType
parameters.description:
enum: [view,pip]
Session type of the session to open. possible values view and pip, default value is view

parameters.name: daiConsentBlob
parameters.description: The daiConsentBlob received from the GET /household/me/daiPreferences/{consentGroup}/display or from the PUT /household/me/daiPreferences/{consentGroup} response. The value should be urlEncoded.

parameters.name: source
parameters.description:
Can be supplied as a hint to the server as to the status of the asset that is being played.
Only necessary for use cases where the client received the instanceId from an external agent other than a ctap refAPI response.
Valid values:
* vod - video on demand content
* pvr - pvr recorded content
* catchup - online catchup content
* restart - restart broadcast content

parameters.name: networkType
parameters.description: The type of network the client is using to consume the content.  Clients should attempt to specify the most specific wireless connection type, if it is not possible to detect the specific type of conection a client should use `cell` or `wi-fi`.

parameters.name: isInHome
parameters.description: this flag is set to true if the device is currently in home. This flag is used to enforce in/out home policies.

id.description: Identifier for the session

captureStartTime.description: Capture start time returned in POST /devices/me/playsession response but not in the GET response.

captureEndTime.description: Capture end time returned in POST /devices/me/playsession response but not in the GET response.

keepAliveRate.description: The rate, in seconds, the client should invoke the `keepAlive` link to keep this session active.

restricted.description: Flag to determine if any trick modes are restricted for this Content.  If false then all trick modes are available.  If true see `disabledTrickModes` for the list of trick modes that should be disabled for this Content.

disabledTrickModes.description: A list of trick modes that should be disabled by the client when playing this Content.

trickModes.description: Details of what trick modes (pause, rewind, fast forward, jump) are supported when playing back this content

startPlayPosition.description: If present the position that the player should start from, in seconds, when playing the content.

drmType.description: The type of DRM applied to the content or channel.

blob.description: An opaque blob to be passed by the application to the player component.  The player component will know how to unpack this blob into the required data.

drmProperties.description: An object supplying the DRM properties to use to play back this content or channel

adInsertion.description: The adInsertion applicable for this session. This is GIGO object moving over from SM to Client

sessionBlob.description: The session blob needed to be sent to SM in the payload of the keep-alive request, this will be added to the JSON body of the request with the key 'sessionBlob'

playbackStartTime.description: Event start time when the authorization becomes valid. Client is expected to start playback at this time. Returned only in POST

playbackEndTime.description: Event end time when the authorization is no longer valid. Client is expected to stop playback at this time. Returned only in POST

playUrl.description: The URL the client should use to acquire and play the content.  The URL will be in a format appropriate for the device.  The Application should be able to pass the URL to thePlayer component in the client which should be able to understand how to play the content.

keepAlive.description: The link the client should call to inform the server that the session is still active and should be kept alive.  The client should call this URL every `keepAliveRate` seconds. This link must be invoked with a POST verb.

_links.description: A set of links to allow the client to playback the content

schema.description: Schema for a play session

post.description:
Update a play session with new client state, e.g. the network type the client is connected on.  The session may still be valid and the API will return 204 and the client can continue to consume from the same session.  The session may not be valid any more and the API will return with 403 with an error code to indicate if the client should attempt to create a new session or not, in either case the session is no longer valid and the client should cease consumption from the session.
**Errors:**
- NETWORK_TYPE_ERROR - It is not possible to play this content on the devices current network
- SESSION_RECREATION_REQUIRED - This session is no longer valid, however the client may try to create a new session to consume the content

parameters.name: sessionType
parameters.description:
enum: [view,pip]
The session type which the session is updated to, possible values are view and pip.

204.description: The play session is still valid, no response body as nothing has changed.

put.description:
Update the active UserProfileId of this device. Only the special value 'me' is supported as the deviceId.
Client can use the api /userProfiles to get the existing userProfileIds and /devices/me to see the current device's current activeUserProfile.
The http code 303(redirect) is returned with the "Location" value to initiate the "rebuild session data" sequence.
The http layer in the client is expected to correctly handle this redirect and as a result,
The final response from this call will be httpCode 200 with the updated device details in its body.

parameters.name: x-pin-token
parameters.description: Identifies the token received in PIN verification response.

userProfileId.description: The user profile ID of the active profile on this device.

schema.description: Schema to update the activeUserProfileId of device

Return all root categories. This is the list of root categories that will be returned without child categories or any hypermedia links content
When depth parameter is given and its value is more than 1 the response will include up do 'depth' levels of children of root categories.
Every leaf category in the response will also contain a link for fetching its content.

get.description: Returns the list of channel genres.  Note this list may be smaller than the list of all genres. For example, can be used for fetching the genre drop-down in the guide screen, or for displaying a channelGenre swimlane. It may also include special "All channels" genre which will have no genreId field.

parameters.name: Accept-Language
parameters.description:
Identifies the requested response language. This should be an ISO 639-1 two letter code. Subcodes (like en-GB) are aslo supported.
Give this header in GET methods where the response can be returned in different natural languages.
note: if the x-response-lang header is also given, its value will take precedence over the value of this header.

parameters.name: x-response-lang
parameters.description:
Identifies the requested response language. This should be an ISO 639-1 two letter code. Subcodes (like en-GB) are aslo supported.
Give this header in GET methods where the response can be returned in different natural languages.
This header is supported in addtion to the standard 'Accept-Language' header. If both are given, the value in this header will be used.

get.description:
Returns the given category's details and a list of its child categories.
when the depth parameter is given and its value is more than 1, the response will include up do 'depth' levels of children of the given category.
Every leaf category in the response will also contain links (regular/shared) for fetching its content.

get.description: Get all contents matching the given search criteria.

parameters.name: Accept-Language
parameters.description:
Identifies the requested response language. This should be an ISO 639-1 two letter code. Subcodes (like en-GB) are aslo supported.
Give this header in GET methods where the response can be returned in different natural languages.
note: if the x-response-lang header is also given, its value will take precedence over the value of this header.

parameters.name: x-response-lang
parameters.description:
Identifies the requested response language. This should be an ISO 639-1 two letter code. Subcodes (like en-GB) are aslo supported.
Give this header in GET methods where the response can be returned in different natural languages.
This header is supported in addtion to the standard 'Accept-Language' header. If both are given, the value in this header will be used.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of entries to return in the response list.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: phrase to search for (exact match in case searchOptions is not specified) within title, cast and keywords.  The value must be URL encoded to support special characters (+, &, ? etc)

parameters.name: searchOptions
parameters.description:
Control search criteria options. Valid values:
* matchPhrase - exact match. (default in case no parameter is defined)
* matchPhrasePrefix - enable prefix match.

parameters.name: isAdult
parameters.description: Setting the parameter to true will include content marked as Adult in the resulting list. If this parameter is not defined the adult content will be filtered out.

parameters.name: isErotic
parameters.description: Setting the parameter to true will include content marked as Erotic in the resulting list. If this parameter is not defined the erotic content will be filtered out.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description:
Starting point relative to a location (specified by the locator, channelId or logicalChannelNumber parameter) where entries in the response list should be selected from.
Limited to 255 to prevent long running queries on the implementation.
Clients should get results to obtain a new locator, channelId or logicalChannelNumber (depending on API) to page further through the list.

parameters.name: locator
parameters.description:
Identifies a logical location in the list to locate the pagination at.
This parameter is used as the location point as a base for the offset parameter.
Values are opaque to the client and retrieved from previous calls to a list API.
If no `locator` or other locating parameter supplied the response will be at the start of the list.

schema.description: Schema for a list of Content

content.title: Spider-Man 2
content.synopsis: Peter Parker is beset with troubles in his failing personal life as he battles a brilliant scientist named Doctor Otto Octavius.

content.title: Pilot
content.synopsis: FBI Agent Booth needs forensic anthropologist Dr. Brennan's help to solve the case of a decomposed body found in a pond in Arlington National Cemetery. She agrees to help if she is a full partner in the case.

get.description: Get the metadata for the specific show by it's id

parameters.name: Accept-Language
parameters.description:
Identifies the requested response language. This should be an ISO 639-1 two letter code. Subcodes (like en-GB) are aslo supported.
Give this header in GET methods where the response can be returned in different natural languages.
note: if the x-response-lang header is also given, its value will take precedence over the value of this header.

parameters.name: x-response-lang
parameters.description:
Identifies the requested response language. This should be an ISO 639-1 two letter code. Subcodes (like en-GB) are aslo supported.
Give this header in GET methods where the response can be returned in different natural languages.
This header is supported in addtion to the standard 'Accept-Language' header. If both are given, the value in this header will be used.

parameters.name: source
parameters.description:
source of the show item.
  * ltv - broadcast TV content
  * vod - video on demand content
  * pvr - pvr recorded content

id.description: Unique identifier for this asset

contentType.description: The type of this asset.  Determines if the asset has any parent or child relationships to other assets

source.description: The different sources of an asset. In case of grouped content, this is the source of the collapsed items

startDateTime.description: For ltv,catchup,pvr standalone/episodes assets, the date-time this asset is broadcast on the associated channel. Format is ISO 8601 date-time

isEntitled.description: Determines if this household is entitled to play this asset.

isVodFavorite.description: Determines if this item has been marked as favorite. When property is missing it is considered as false.

expirationDateTime.description: The date-time at which this instance is no longer available. Provided only if applicable (e.g. CDVR expiration or VOD expiration when expiringSoon content flag is set). Format is ISO 8601 date-time

rentalExpiration.description: The date-time at which rental entitlements expires. It will be present only for vods that have been rented by the user. Format is ISO 8601 date-time

lastPlayPosition.description: The last position, in seconds from the start, that the user got to when last viewing this asset. Applicable to standalone/episodes assets of type vod/pvr/catchup.  The value is based on the parameter supplied by the application in the DELETE devices/me/playsessions API when tearing down this asset's playsession. The parameter supplied only when the value is non-zero.

duration.description: The duration of this asset in seconds.  Only relevant for standalone/episode contentType.

contentDuration.description: The original content duration. May be different from duration.  For PVR asset it represents duration of original content. The value is not provided when identical to duration.

contentFlags.description: The content flags applicable for this asset. This is personalized for the client. In some use cases partial list of contentFlags will be returned, depending on API used

booking.description: The booking associated with this asset.

purchaseDateTime.description: Time stamp reflecting the purchase date (if applicable). format is ISO 8601 date-time

purchases.description: The list of Authorization status of the offers associated with the asset

items.description: The Authorization status of the offers associated with the asset

bookmarks.description: The list of bookmarks that are present for the asset. It is returned only as part of contentInstances API

linearInstanceId.description: Corresponding linear asset Id, for catchup asset only

restartContentId.description: Corresponding restart asset Id, applicable for linear asset with restartAvailable content flag. This property is provided only as part of contentInstances API. It should be used to create restart play session with /devices/me/playsessions/<restartContentId> API

branding.description: In case of shop in shop asset - optional branding information of the provider

collapsedItemsCount.description: Number of collapsed items for this asset. Present only for show/season/group assets.

collapsedItemsContentType.description: The contentType of collapsed items. In case of show collapsed items can be of type season in case of series with season or episodes in case of open series. Present only for show/season/group assets.

title.description: The main display title for this asset.  For 'episodes' and 'seasons' this will be the 'show' title.

episodeTitle.description: Optionally provided, for episode assets only. This is the title of the episode.

seasonNumber.description: The number of the season.  Only supplied for Asset of type 'episode' and 'season'

episodeNumber.description: The number of the episode.  Only supplied for Asset of type 'episode'

showId.description: The identifier of the associated Show.  Only supplied for Asset of type 'episode' and 'season'

seasonId.description: The identifier of the associated Season.  Only supplied for asset of type 'episode'

externalId.description: External content/video identifier for third party video applications, coming from federated search sources, i.e. youtube or netflix

externalPackageId.description: External content/video Package identifier which comes from ADI ingest and used by service provider in order to track content package

productionYear.description: The year the asset content was produced

productionLocation.description: The location in which the asset content was produced

starRating.description: The editorially supplied star rating for the asset.  Supplied as an integer.  The platform will define the supplyer of the rating and hence the range, (e.g. 1-5, 1-10, 100%)  The UI will determine how this value is to be presented.

audioLanguages.description: The display strings for the available audio languages for this asset.  Note the API will provide the language names in the language of the user profile accessing the API.

audioFormat.description: The display string for the audio format this asset is available in.  For example 'Dolby Prologic'.  Note that asset may have several audio formats available, this is the primary display name for the best audio.

videoFormat.description: The display string for the video format this asset is available in.  For example '1080i HD'.  Note that asset may be available in other video formats, this is the primary display name for the best video format.

subtitleLanguages.description: The display strings for the available subtitle languages for this asset.  Note the API will provide the language names in the language of the user profile accessing the API.

contentAdvisories.description: The advisory flags applicable for this asset. This is personalized for the client.

externalFlags.description: Externally driven flags associated with this asset. Values are controlled by the operator and are opaque to API. Application code can use the flags as UI indications.

assetPage.description: the detail page to display for this external asset

playback.description: the link to invoke for playback of this external asset

type.description: the type of link for the external content

externalLinks.description: A set of links to allow the client to access external content

media.description: Media to use to present this asset.

actors.description: The list of actors for this asset.

directors.description: The list of directors for this asset.

synopsis.description: A short form of synopsis to display when Asset is displayed in a list, summary or grid view.  Always supplied when synopsis is available.  Note: some Asset may have no synopsis

longSynopsis.description: A long form of synopsis to display when Asset is displayed in detail.  It is returned only as part of contentInstances API and in groupContent responses, but not from other aggregation   Note: some Asset may have no synopsis or no long synopsis

studioCode.description: The registration code assigned to the asset by the studio providing it

name.description: The display string to use to indicate this parental rating.

value.description: The value to use for enforcing parental control policies

parentalRating.description: The parental rating assigned to this asset.

externalStarRatings.description: List of star rating provided by external providers like IMdb.

trailerContentId.description: Trailer Identifier, this id can be used to play the trailer.

channel.description: The channel description. The property is not supplied when asset is already part of channel schema (/agg/grid API) or in conflict schema.

recordingState.description: State of the recording progress for a booking.

locator.description: Locator of the asset that can be used in paging requests.

bookingStatesKey.description: A key which can be used to find booking state of this asset inside booking state list provided by API /personal/bookingStates. This property is provided only as part of non-personalized API /shared/grid

restartEventKey.description: A key which can be used to find restart information for this asset inside restartEvents list provided by API /shared/restartEvents. This property is provided only as part of non-personalized API /shared/grid

entitledPpvKey.description: A key which can be used to find entitled state of this asset inside ppvEntitlements list provided by API /personal/ppvEntitlements. This property is provided only for ppv events as part of non-personalized API /shared/grid

viewHistoryKey.description: A key which can be used to find viewing history of this asset inside viewHistory list provided by API /personal/viewingHistory. This property is provided only as part of non-personalized API /shared/content

offerKeys.description: A list of offer keys which can be used to check entitlement status of this asset by matching with entitled offers list provided by API /personal/entitledOffers. This property is provided only as part of non-personalized API /shared/content

consentGroup.description: The dynamic ads provider identifier for this asset, relevant for VOD assets only. Opting in or out to getting targeted advertisements is done per consentGroup

schema.description: Base Schema for an asset which can be either a concrete episode/standalone event or a grouped content (season/show/group aka boxset). This schema replaces instance.schema and content.schema starting from API version 1.6.0

example.title: Game of Thrones

purchases.marketingMsg: Purchase Game of Thrones for 9.99 USD
Purchase Game of Thrones season 5 for 5.5 USD

example.synopsis: Noble families in the seven kingdoms of Westeros vie for control of the Iron Throne. Fantasy drama, based on George RR Martin's A Song of Ice and Fire novels.

restartEventKey.description: A key which can be used to find restart information for this asset inside restartEvents list provided by API /shared/restartEvents. This property is provided only as part of non-personalized API /shared/grid

entitledPpvKey.description: A key which can be used to find entitled state of this asset inside ppvEntitlements list provided by API /personal/ppvEntitlements. This property is provided only for ppv events as part of non-personalized API /shared/grid

viewHistoryKey.description: A key which can be used to find viewing history of this asset inside viewHistory list provided by API /personal/viewingHistory. This property is provided only as part of non-personalized API /shared/content

offerKeys.description: A list of offer keys which can be used to check entitlement status of this asset by matching with entitled offers list provided by API /personal/entitledOffers. This property is provided only as part of non-personalized API /shared/content

consentGroup.description: The dynamic ads provider identifier for this asset, relevant for VOD assets only. Opting in or out to getting targeted advertisements is done per consentGroup

schema.description: Base Schema for an asset which can be either a concrete episode/standalone event or a grouped content (season/show/group aka boxset). This schema replaces instance.schema and content.schema starting from API version 1.6.0
